attributes.action: Allow all students to wear trousers and school shorts as part of school uniform.
attributes.additional_details:
Both boys & girls should be allowed to wear shorts in summer to get enough Vitamin D which comes from sunlight between April and September between the hours 11am - 3pm when children are at school.

https://www.nhs.uk/live-well/healthy-body/how-to-get-vitamin-d-from-sunlight/

https://www.theguardian.com/education/2017/jun/22/teenage-boys-wear-skirts-to-school-protest-no-shorts-uniform-policy

https://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-126456/School-face-court-girls-wear-trousers.html
attributes.background: Trousers for many girls are more practical and comfortable enforcing the wearing of skirts plays into a misogynistic sterotype of feminity that is not longer useful and potentially harmful.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition as its about something the UK Government and Parliament are not responsible for. This would be the responsibility of the school. 

You might like to sign this petition instead:
